snippet: Fully 53 percent supported Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand's re-election, her best showing yet, a survey from Siena College found.
abstract: Fully 53 percent supported Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand's re-election, her best showing yet, a survey from Siena College found.
lead_paragraph: Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand of New York, a first-term Democrat who is a target of Republicans this year, started the week with hopeful news that underscores the momentum she has been building. A poll released on Monday by Siena College found that the proportion of registered voters who think Ms. Gillibrand should be re-elected in the fall was 53 percent, tying her highest figure, which she first reached in a similar poll Siena conducted in November.

headline.main: Gillibrand Favored by Most New York Voters, Poll Finds
